title: RPA To Make BPS Advance Payments In August

content.text: In 2022, we made Basic Payment Scheme (BPS) payments in two instalments to support farmers and landowners at a time of increased pressure on cash flow.
Advance payments of up to 50% were made from the end of July and across August, with the balance payments made from December 2022.
We have listened to the feedback that we received in response to making BPS payments in this way and will be making advance payments again this year.
In response to feedback on how we can make improvements, BPS advance payments will be paid on a single day, which is 1 August 2023.
The payments will be up to 50% of the total annual BPS payment. The remaining balance will be paid in December 2023.

Once your payment has been made, a remittance notice will be sent in the post confirming the amount paid. When the balance payment is made in December, you will receive a claim statement explaining how the 2023 payments have been worked out.
Both the advance and balance payments will reflect progressive reductions applied as we phase out BPS payments to 2027.
You can use the online calculator as a guide to understanding how progressive reductions could affect your BPS payments.
For more information about BPS, you can read the guidance on GOV.UK.
It’s important to make sure that all of your details are correct in the Rural Payments service.
For guidance on how to update your password, email address, details and permissions, we have created a series of videos you can follow on our YouTube channel.
